input_text: From Patient: Person1 has done well managing pain while eliminating Oxycontin ER 10mg (as Dr. Person2 was keen Person1 do ASAP). Person1 has been taking Oxycodone HCL 15mg, usually split to 7.5mg, about every MM/DD/YYYY through the day, with MM/DD/YYYY off while sleeping. He needs another 7.5mg every so often, usually MM/DD/YYYY. Person1 needs a refill of Oxycodone HCL by MM/DD/YYYY, Wed. MM/DD/YYYY. Person1 also needs a new Rx for Meloxicam 15mg, if Dr. Person3 wants him to continue taking it. Last, we had a LOCATION appt with Dr. Person4 MM/DD/YYYY. Dr. Person4 asked me to give Dr. Person3 his mobile tel. no. as they have missed each other in MM/DD/YYYY. Dr. Person4: XXX-XXX-XXXX (mob.), XXX-XXX-XXXX (off.) input_text: From Patient: Hello Person1, thank you and All for your help! Person2 is having a tough day with pain MM/DD/YYYY; he's not in shape to get to the office. I am on the lookout for the permission / patient approval document that is being sent by the blood testing lab. I'll let you know as soon as that is completed. I would like to add one more Rx request: a new script for Lidocaine / Prilocaine cream, please. We are both at the limit of getting "stuck." Most appreciative! One more bit of info for Dr. Person3: Dr. Person4 was speaking with Dr. Person5 (MSKCC) to see if there might be a clinical trial suitable for Person2. Her thinking is that might be a (better?) alternative to radiation, which would be administered only at a palliative level given Person2's previous radiation treatment history. She also told us she expected any chemotherapy Dr. Person3 might determine would be subsequent to radiation (if that is the route we g o). Thanks again, Person6

input_text: From Patient: Hello Person1. Yep, just got a call for MM/DD/YYYY w Dr. B on MM/DD/YYYY. Re Oxy 15mg rapid release: per Dr. Person2's desire and Dr. B agree to get Person3 off Oxy ext release ASAP, and work down to lowest usage Oxy rapid w/o dealing w break through pain, which can be pretty nasty. I've set up Person3's other am, MM/DD/YYYY, pm meds w 7.5mg Oxy 3x diem, with 7.5 Oxy boosters once, twice a day as needed. Trying to keep Oxy steady at MM/DD/YYYY, but MM/DD/YYYY had to go MM/DD/YYYY. 30 count has gotten him through MM/DD/YYYY, considering ste p down and a few tough pain MM/DD/YYYY thereafter. Re Eliquis: MM/DD/YYYY two 5mg tabs morning and night; MM/DD/YYYY one 5mg am and one 5mg pm. Sig swelling (but improving slightly) swelling of right leg persists. Person3 is tolerating all meds well and following directions. Appetite, a bit of a struggle, as expected; digestion normal (that may become diarrhea as radiation has started MM/DD/YYYY). Dr. B recommends Metamucil 1 tsp 2x diem. Other symptoms: quite tired, napping, MM/DD/YYYY recently interrupted by anxiety attacks. Thanks a ton, Person1, best – Person4

From Provider: Ms. Person1, I had ordered both tumor markers, adding the CEA (just another marker in this situation) to the CA27.29 and agree that the CA27.29 has been a very good marker for you. I was happy to see that this was trending down. We do not have a comparison for the CEA, but if this serves us value in the future, we will then have something to look back and compare to. Take care, RDL ----- Message ----- From: Sent: To: Subject: RE: Visit Follow-Up Question Hi Dr Person2, At our last appointment we discussed getting the cancer antigen test at my next blood work. I thought we were doing the CA 27 Dash 29 that I have always had done but no results have come in for that. A test result for CEA came in but I don't know what that is. I have nothing to compare that to although it appears the numbers pretty high which is concerning. I was wondering if there was a reason for switching to a different test? The 27/29 has been a good indicator for me in the past. Thank you

input_text: From Patient: Thank you Person1.

From Provider: Hi Person1, Patients on PI3 kinase inhibitors like Person2 can get a type of pneumonia called PCP pneumonia. Bactrim is an antibiotic given to prevent this. It is taken as one tablet on MM/DD/YYYY, MM/DD/YYYY, and MM/DD/YYYY. Please pick it up and start it. Let me know if you have any issues with it like rashes or diarrhea . Most people tolerate it fine 3 times per week. I realized you were not on it when I finalized my last note, and I thought I messaged you, but it sounds like I didn't. I apologize for the confusion. Person3

input_text: From Patient: Hi Dr. Person1, Thank you for my visit today. You said I was your hero! Thanks! But you are my hero by saving my life! You are a fantastic doctor! Thanks again. Merry Christmas and a Happy and Healthy New Year! Regards, Person2

labels.Span: Thank you for my visit today
You said I was your hero!
Merry Christmas and a Happy and Healthy New Year!

input_text: From Patient: Hi Dr. Person1, I know you put my Xeloda refills in for me with org pharmacy. I have been getting from them since HH:MM. Today I got a call from Org3 saying they got the request and none in stock. Did some change my pharmacy for Xeloda to Org3? I would prefer to continue with org pharmacy. Please check to see what happened and let me know. Again, thanks so much! Regards, Person2

labels.Span: I know you put my Xeloda refills in for me with ACS pharmacy
I have been getting from them since HH:MM

input_text: From Provider: Call me with any problems Person1. Merry Christmas to you also!
From Patient: Hi Dr. Person1, I have a choice tomorrow for Moderna or Johnson and Johnson Need help..which one should I go with? Thanks so much! Person3

From Provider: Just the day before chemo and the day after, so after today you will stop. Then the day before your next chemo, you will take 2 and the day after another two. I'm glad the Ativan helped. Dr. Person1 did order more for home. Sincerely, Person2
From Patient: Thank you I understand appreciate it

From Provider: Usually skipping one treatment would not be enough time to make it start growing again. How long have you had the pain for? What kind of pain is it? Does anything make it better or worse?

labels.Span: How long have  you had the pain for?
What kind of pain is it?
Does anything make it better or worse?

input_text: From Patient: First in am or last appointment of day after 4 pm I am working. Thank you

From Patient: Another question that just popped up and I am sorry my sister didn ask when she went in with my father. He will be going for a colonscopy and endoscopy MM/DD/YYYY. He hasn had one since his cancer diagnosis. It is safe for him to go through that?

labels.Span: I am sorry my sister didn ask when she went in with my father
He will be going for a colonscopy and endoscopy MM/DD/YYYY

I can let you know when it is signed

input_text: From Provider: Hi, Does it look any different? Any redness, warmth? Chills, fever? Person1
From Patient: I'm planning on starting at 2 pm today, I do have a cold and throat a little irritated. My temp is 98.2. I did home covid test which was negative. Is it okay to start?

labels.Span: I do have a cold and throat a little irritated
I did home covid test which was negative

input_text: From Provider: Person1- Best to start tomorrow MM/DD/YYYY in the morning since the Dabrafenib is 150mg every 12 hours unless you plan on taking it at 2am. Thanks Person2 RN

labels.Span: the Dabrafenib is 150mg every 12 hours unless you plan on taking it at 2am
